DiscreteTimeLib.signals¶

class DiscreteTimeLib.signals.DiscreteTimeSignal(data=())¶

Discrete-time signal object, implemented with digital signal processing functions.

Parameters

data (numpy.ndarray) –

Two-dimensional array-like representing signal data.

For e.g., ((0, 2), (1, 4)) indicates x[0] = 2 and x[1] = 4.

Examples

>>> data = ((-3, -2.2),
...         (-2, -1),
...         (-1, 1.5),
...         (0, 2),
...         (1, 3.3),
...         (2, 5),
...         (5, 12))
>>> x_n = DiscreteTimeSignal(data)
>>> print(x_n)
    x[n]
-3  -2.2
-2  -1.0
-1   1.5
0   2.0
1   3.3
2   5.0
5  12.0
